column4: Okay, so I create a new connection, I scan and find my home network and click okay, now how do I tell it to connect?  It still says "Last Used: Never"
wired? wireless? what encryption if any? associated with the ap?
no ap? that means there is not a wifi spot to connect to
what does ifconfig show it as ? wlan0 ?
whats the wireless chipset
sudo dhclient eth1    yields what
then associate with the ap and try again
how do I associate with the ap?
did you check the specific steps in the link I gave you on exactly how to do that?
or its hidden
I'm sorry but nothing here tells me how to add or associate an ap with my network that I can find.  It tells me to check with my ap and see if it see's my card or not, but not how to associate
I just gave you the command
what was the exact command you gave and the exact error message
and the command you gave?
please pastebin the out put of ifconfig, lspci
http://pastebin.com/C23TJSMH   I threw in the iwconfig at the end as well
and you followed all of the steps in the broadcom wiki, extracting firmware or using from additional drivers
because it showing up as eth1 leads me believe the device is not recognized properly
then try the modprobe steps again
the sudo modprobe -r b43 ssb wl  line gives me a Module ssb is in use. error
that seems extreme, not sure how to fix as you seem to have backtracked / ie used one method then another. perhaps reverse steps and start fresh
I'd try anything before reinstalling, that truly is a last resort
